events.event_description: Henry Hub natural gas spot price declined significantly to $3.27/MMBtu in January 2023 due to warmer weather and reduced consumption.
events.citation: After averaging just under $6.50/MMBtu in 2022, the Henry Hub price declined to $3.27/MMBtu in January 2023, driven by warmer-than-average weather and reduced natural gas consumption in most of the United States.

events.event_description: U.S. natural gas production reached record highs in 2023.
events.citation: In our January STEO, U.S. dry natural gas production increases 1.5 billion cubic feet per day (Bcf/d) in 2024 from record highs in 2023 to average 105.0 Bcf/d.

events.event_description: Natural gas working inventories remained above the five-year average throughout 2023.
events.citation: Working natural gas inventories were above the previous five-year (2018–22) average for all of 2023

events.event_description: LNG exports are forecast to increase significantly by 17% (2.1 Bcf/d) in 2025.
events.citation: liquefied natural gas (LNG) exports, which we forecast to increase by 4% (0.5 Bcf/d) in 2024 and 17% (2.1 Bcf/d) in 2025

events.event_description: Average Henry Hub natural gas price in 2023 was $2.54/MMBtu, less than half of 2022's average price.
events.citation: Despite increased demand, our forecast prices for 2024 and 2025 are less than half the annual average price in 2022 and are only slightly higher than the $2.54/MMBtu we reported for 2023.
